title: it's just target
description: Your bosses will be pressuring you to meet unrealistic expectations. Yes, it's important to put in effort. No, minor mistakes should not be treated as if the earth is literally crumbling in on itself. If you don't let it get to you, it's fine. But God some people need a reality check

title: Disappointing
description: Position On demand guest advocate. It seems like a good idea. Allow,  the advocates that are not on demand  to request or call off easier  and allow some to pick up those shifts. However, Its quite competitive to get shifts.   The training was sabotaged

title: They pick and choose when to do their job
description: When I first started I was pretty chill. But when new management came and switch everything up, it became a awful, chaotic and messy. People there are so toxic and management pick when and who they enforce there rules upon. Always asking you to stay

title: Overall toxic workplace
description: Unrealistic expectations of employees, managers and coworkers that gossip like high schoolers, aggressive management and lack of understand for your personal circumstances

title: Soleless
description: Felt pretty sole less working there. No sense of purpose and basically just had to move massive fixtures to random locations based off of what corporate said. Management was not understanding of workers circumstances and seemed just as sole less as corporate.

title: okay
description: managers a little bit hard but it was a good place to work good pay was glad to have worked there was better than walmart than i would say just had to move away would work again

title: Good Starting Job
description: The people were always friendly and easy to talk to and ask for advice. Schedules were accommodating and were only busy during holiday periods. Would recommend.

title: Easy going
description: Working at Target was fairly easy, though it was underpaid and difficult to get full time hours if that's what you are looking for. My team leads were great to work with

title: Okay
description: Schedule could be improved as there are a lot of moments where you will be alone. The work is not too hard but can be very busy at times. Overall, the job is easy and the pay isn't too bad.

title: Not as great as you think!!
description: What is the best part of working at the company?

title: Great place to work
description: Besides the angry customers management  is really good. Would recommend to anyone trying to get a start in customer service. The associates are cool people

title: Good hard work
description: Day to day the work would change. I enjoyed putting out all the new items and ensuring people had a nice place to shop. Got to go home at the end of the day feeling like I worked hard.

title: Ok
description: Okay pay but if they ever train you to work in Fullfillment, that’s all you’ll be scheduled to do. Full timers get priority over part timers that have been with the company forever. certain bias over departments such as specialty sales not being taken seriously as other ones.

title: Dead end job, poor management, favoritism, exploitation
description: Favoritism and being popular is a big thing here. If you have family who are leads or in HR they’ll schedule you more and give the rest of us less hours than them even if you’re a great worker. Poor management, bad pay, you can work your heart and soul

title: They will have unrealistic expectations of you
description: They push too hard. You will try as hard as you can to do everything they want and more, yet it still isn’t good enough. I got super sick within my first 90 days and had to call off a few days as I was in the hospital. From that point on, mgmt made

title: nice
description: decent, worked here for long time.good for first or second job. was guest advocate and cashier. drive ups were alot in heat though. i recommend if ur young

title: Avoid if you can.
description: What is the best part of working at the company?

title: Target was a fantastic job for a majority of my time there, but dropped off in quality.
description: Target was a fantastic job for a majority of my time there, but at a point the amount of hours I got dropped to a heavily suspicious 6 per month.  I've talked to my manager and store lead about it to little success.  There's quite a few benefits to

title: Fun and engaging workplace
description: I have worked at 2 Targets as a barista and both have helped me grow confidence in social skills. The best parts were to engage in customer service and connections, staff is fun and it’s exciting to craft new drinks. The cons of working as a barista

title: People Lead
description: Working at Target as a People Lead was a fast-paced but rewarding experience. No two days were the same — my daily responsibilities ranged from supporting team member scheduling and payroll, to leading new hire orientations and helping resolve HR or
